all yur ubuntu is mine: awesome! maybe you can answer my question there
no, there is no hidden user accounts
the account you refer to is not enabled.  your line in /etc/shadow should look like this: games:*:13991:0:99999:7:::

if you try to create a user account called games it won't let you, says it's already in use, if you sudo passwd any thing else it says no such account but if you sudo passwd games it lets you set a pass word and allowed me to log in on tty1 and use the games in the directory
it isnt a hidden account, its in /etc/passwd and /etc/shadow
i enabled it to log in to tty1 to find out what it is for
midknhit ah thank you, you wouldn't know what it's for would you?
its a system used account, you shouldnt use it for login
do you forsee any negative affects from setting a password for it? besides the usual security issues
its a very common login, and probably used to preserve games group ownership.  i would just put it back and create another account to mess with

awesome thank you sir, you are a gentleman and a scholar from your toenails to your collar. in any event I was just trying to set up and account so i can run a second simultanious x session with a minimalist window manager for running games
sudo adduser <username> then change your window manager in session options when you login from gdm
